t: Psalm 18
God the Sovereign Savior

To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David the servant of the Lord, who spoke to the Lord the words of this song on the day that the Lord delivered him from the hand of all his enemies and from the hand of Saul. And he said:
I*pn will love You, O Lord,*s my strength.
The*ld Lord*s is my rock and my fortress and my deliverer; My*ld God, my strength, in whom I will trust; My*ld shield and the horn of my salvation, my stronghold.
I*ld will call upon the Lord,*s who*i is*i worthy*i to be praised; So*ld shall I be saved from my enemies.
The*ln pangs of death surrounded me, And*ld the floods of ungodliness made me afraid.
The*ld sorrows of Sheol surrounded me; The*ld snares of death confronted me.
In*ld my distress I called upon the Lord,*s And*ld cried out to my God; He*ld heard my voice from His temple, And*ld my cry came before Him, even*i to His ears.
Then*ln the earth shook and trembled; The*ld foundations of the hills also quaked and were shaken, Because*ld He was angry.
Smoke*ld went up from His nostrils, And*ld devouring fire from His mouth; Coals*ld were kindled by it.
He*ld bowed the heavens also, and came down With*ld darkness under His feet.
And*ld He rode upon a cherub, and flew; He*ld flew upon the wings of the wind.
He*ld made darkness His secret place; His*ld canopy around Him was*i dark waters And*ild thick clouds of the skies.
From*ld the brightness before Him, His*ld thick clouds passed with hailstones and coals of fire.
The*ln Lord*s thundered from heaven, And*ld the Most High uttered His voice, Hailstones*ld and coals of fire.
He*ld sent out His arrows and scattered the foe, Lightnings*ld in abundance, and He vanquished them.
Then*ld the channels of the sea were seen, The*ld foundations of the world were uncovered At*ld Your rebuke, O Lord,*s At*ld the blast of the breath of Your nostrils.
He*ln sent from above, He took me; He*ld drew me out of many waters.
He*ld delivered me from my strong enemy, From*ld those who hated me, For*ld they were too strong for me.
They*ld confronted me in the day of my calamity, But*ld the Lord*s was my support.
He*ld also brought me out into a broad place; He*ld delivered me because He delighted in me.
The*ln Lord*s rewarded me according to my righteousness; According*ld to the cleanness of my hands He*ld has recompensed me.
For*ld I have kept the ways of the Lord,*s And*ld have not wickedly departed from my God.
For*ld all His judgments were*i before me, And*ld I did not put away His statutes from me.
I*ld was also blameless before Him, And*ld I kept myself from my iniquity.
Therefore*ld the Lord*s has recompensed me according to my righteousness, According*ld to the cleanness of my hands in His sight.
With*ln the merciful You will show Yourself merciful; With*ld a blameless man You will show Yourself blameless;
With*ld the pure You will show Yourself pure; And*ld with the devious You will show Yourself shrewd.
For*ld You will save the humble people, But*ld will bring down haughty looks.
For*ln You will light my lamp; The*ld Lord*s my God will enlighten my darkness.
For*ld by You I can run against a troop, By*ld my God I can leap over a wall.
As*ild for*i God, His way is*i perfect; The*ld word of the Lord*s is proven; He*ld is*i a shield to all who trust in Him.
For*ln who is*i God, except the Lord?*s And*ld who is*i a rock, except our God?
It*ild is*i God who arms me with strength, And*ld makes my way perfect.
He*ld makes my feet like the feet*i of*i deer, And*ld sets me on my high places.
He*ld teaches my hands to make war, So*ld that my arms can bend a bow of bronze.
You*ln have also given me the shield of Your salvation; Your*ld right hand has held me up, Your*ld gentleness has made me great.
You*ld enlarged my path under me, So*ld my feet did not slip.
I*ln have pursued my enemies and overtaken them; Neither*ld did I turn back again till they were destroyed.
I*ld have wounded them, So*ld that they could not rise; They*ld have fallen under my feet.
For*ld You have armed me with strength for the battle; You*ld have subdued under me those who rose up against me.
You*ld have also given me the necks of my enemies, So*ld that I destroyed those who hated me.
They*ld cried out, but there*i was*i none to save; Even*ild to the Lord,*s but He did not answer them.
Then*ld I beat them as fine as the dust before the wind; I*ld cast them out like dirt in the streets.
You*ln have delivered me from the strivings of the people; You*ld have made me the head of the nations; A*ld people I have not known shall serve me.
As*ld soon as they hear of me they obey me; The*ld foreigners submit to me.
The*ld foreigners fade away, And*ld come frightened from their hideouts.
The*ln Lord*s lives! Blessed*ld be*i my Rock! Let*ld the God of my salvation be exalted.
It*ild is*i God who avenges me, And*ld subdues the peoples under me;
He*ld delivers me from my enemies. You*ld also lift me up above those who rise against me; You*ld have delivered me from the violent man.
Therefore*ld I will give thanks to You, O Lord,*s among the Gentiles, And*ld sing praises to Your name.
Great*ln deliverance He gives to His king, And*ld shows mercy to His anointed, To*ld David and his descendants forevermore.
